column1:
7.1.3.6	
Guidelines for the treatment of clinical stage I non-seminoma testis
Stage IA (pT1, no vascular invasion): low-risk

Offer surveillance if the patient is willing and able to comply.
Strong

Offer adjuvant chemotherapy with one course of cisplatin, etoposide, bleomycin (BEP) in 
Strong
low-risk patients not willing (or unsuitable) to undergo surveillance.

Offer adjuvant chemotherapy with one course of BEP, or surveillance and discuss the 
advantages and disadvantages.
Offer surveillance to patients not willing to undergo adjuvant chemotherapy.

Offer nerve-sparing retroperitoneal lymph node dissection to highly selected patients only; those 
with contraindication to adjuvant chemotherapy and unwilling to accept surveillance.

Primary retroperitoneal lymph node dissection should be advised in men with post-pubertal 
teratoma.
